title: Anivia By the Numbers
body:
Her base health is 465, lowest of any champion in all of league.
Her move speed is 325, with zero evasion, lowest possible speed in all of league.
Her passive (rebirth) cool down is over 4 minutes.
Her “Q” (flash frost) is the slowest skill shot in all of league at a projectile speed of 850. 
Her mana costs are extremely high, Q-120, W-70, E-90, R-75+60 per second.
Her difficulty rating according to riot is 10.
She makes the make bottom 10 of least played every month in all regions.

Her ap ratios are good but her base stats make her competitively irrelevant. Please consider giving her a little love. Knocking 10 off each of her mana costs and bumping her speed up to 335 would make a world of difference.


Note: this the long version of this argument [http://www.reddit.com/r/summonerschool/comments/38bvs2/an_indepth_analysis_and_discussion_on_anivia/](http://www.reddit.com/r/summonerschool/comments/38bvs2/an_indepth_analysis_and_discussion_on_anivia/)

I can't support any anivia buffs. Her numbers are already pretty damn good. 
- She has the lowest health bar because she has 2 health bars
- She is one of the safest laners in the game
- She has two 1.0 scaling skills
- She has a stun that isn't stopped by spell shield
- Her w is one of the best non-ultimate skills in the game
- Her passive makes her incredible tanky
- She has an atk speed slow and a movement speed slow in a very large AoE that is a toggle
- Despite having really low movement speed and no dashes or speed buffs she is still one of the hardest mid laners to kill

You can't just spit out some of her negatives when she has a ton of things going for her.

The one change I could get behind is making her ult toggle not cancel at the drop of a hat. In other words make it more consistent with other toggles.

I acknowledged Anivia's good damage in the original post. I further acknowledge that I am indeed focusing on her current problems and I feel the numbers speak for themselves.   

I don't think she is tanky, even if you multiply an incredibly small amount of health by two, its still a small amount. That's ignoring the early penalty of -40 to both armor and magic resist. Further more, summoner spells like ignite and channeling spells like fiddle's life drain remain active and viable when Anivia becomes an egg. (unlike zac and atrox) The cool down is massive as well. If her passive is on cool down for 4 long minutes minutes, does she still qualify as tanky in the interim? 

I am glad you could bear the thought of improving her ult. I welcome any change that would make it more reliable.

You mention her ratio's but her base damage is also pretty damn good. Think about it this way because of her passive all defensive items are twice as effective on her. HP counts twice and resists count for twice as much. Meaning that if you compare Anivia to any other mid laner with 1 defensive item; Anivia gets twice the effectiveness on it. When you have the -40 resists it is irrelevant unless you are laning against someone that could kill you with auto attacks well in egg form, like zed. Most of the champions in mid lane you play against can't burst you down twice that early unless they have help. Rebirth is single handedly one of the best passives in the game. Well it is up it makes you hard to kill and a risky target because they have to go through two health bars. Meaning it is unattractive for an enemy to focus you and it is unattractive for an enemy to leave you alone. Hence why a four minute cool down on it is appropriate. As far as things like channels going through and ignite etc; Riot should clean that up for consistency sake but it isn't very damaging to her because most champions that have channels can't get to her and the rest aren't played much. Ignite also tends to not be the thing that kills you in egg form.

Her mana costs are high but each individual skill (except e I suppose which requires another spell to be powerful) is very powerful and can change games. If Riot wanted to see her in competitive play they would probably have to lower mana cost on her ult. However if she were to receive such buffs she would probably have to lose out on damage which I don't like.

Her slow speed on q could probably be sped up but that might push the skill to the over powered side because of its high range and quite large stun radius. Her base movement speed could be increased with little to no harm but this would not make her anymore competitive and is just adding fluff that might have to be removed somewhere else at a later time.

Anivia is unique in the sense that she isn't played much but the majority of people who play her have a very good win ratio and a lot of games on her meaning most of the people that are playing her are mains. I would hate to see her change other then like a couple QoL changes. I feel that a lot of other Anivia players are in a similar boat.

I am not entirely sure what her difficulty rating of 10 has to do with anything. She is a hard champ yes but so what? Gives you more pleasure when you master her.

Adding movement speed and lowering mana costs would make her significantly stronger. With her strong bases and strong ratio's it is hard for me to justify any sort of buff as that significantly increases her damage out put and would probably have to be toned down in the future.

The moral of the story is that Anivia isn't in a bad spot, she is good in every meta so far. Really the only thing she needs is some clean up on bugs and things as well as a few minor QoL consistency changes. Anything more is likely to put her in the "my numbers are stupid so therefor I am picked" camp.

I've been playing her a lot recently (some big success and some big failures). Personally I find she doesn't yet have a lane opponent she "can't beat" in essence, she can safely stay at turret, making dives virtually impossible thanks to passive, stun and wall. Then once you do hit 6, you can waveclear so hard with a short R and a long Q. I can push a lane under turret, and attack the enemy who is under the turret from a safe distance, denying them farm SO much. As long as you watch out for enemy jungler. I often run Boots of swiftness on her because he speed is SO horrible, even with ionion boots and alacrity, I often move slower than most other champs around me.

Most of my failures have come from bad decision making (greed) and dodgy mechanics (I need a new mouse, I often cast spells in the wrong direction or off target :/ ) but the biggest cost of playing Anivia is her need for a team play. On her own, she can wreck almost anyone late game 1v1, as long as you have good timing and accuracy. But in a team fight, it's hard to focus one person, as soon as you weaken them into death range, they back off and a full hp champ comes on you. If you don't have a decent peel (like thresh or maokai) or if your team chases blindly leaving your ulti and passive debuffs, chasing with her is a nightmare. By the time you catch up, half your team is dead. Anivia is primarily defensive, and is very bad at chasing. You need a good peel to defend against a whole team, baron and super minions (and they still won't take your turret), but you need an assassin or global ulti to take them out then they retreat. If your tanks are chasing (nasus or malph, etc), they can get kited and killed before you catch up (if not running swiftness). I often have to flash just to be in the game :/

I say all this because I see her as VERY strong, and very applicable in multiple scenarios. If she got buffs she would dominate. I think slightly higher ms and shorter passive at higher levels sounds great. But you can actually control her mana quite well, and if it was reduced, it's make using her SO MUCH EASIER. If i didn't run 2 mana regen items, then I'd have something like 950-1000 AP or something defensive (like GA which can be a bitch on Anivia lol) and with 2 100% ratio skills, that's over 2K damage with two hits. Not including ulti, and not taking into account the low CD on E which means another 1K damage before the enemy can get around your crystalze or recover from your stun. I tried running only 1 mana item, but I was struggling late game to keep going. I could optimise in a number of ways, but I'm experimenting right now (my match history shows how bad some of my experiments have gone) but it'd only take a small reduction in mana costs to allow me to significantly alter my build and build paths, so yeah, ms sounds good (low just not THAT low) and scaling passive.


Edit! No, there is one thing she needs desperately above anything else. Fix that dam Auto attack. I swear, sometimes it does "less" damage than what her base stats suggest, on top of the slow cast time and slow travel time. I understand if they want to make her farming harder, but VERY low on hit damage, with Very slow travel speed and VERY slow cast, makes it too ridiculous. Change one of these things, you don't need 3 gates on JUST aa's, they are always gonna be weak, so you can at least make them land reliably. She will never compete against Ori or Lux, but at least let her last hit a caster minion, cause even those are often too much. 
or give her AA's a bonus like her E, so they do more on hit damage if you've frosted the target, it'll still cost a lot of mana early, but at least you stand a chance at a pre-six wave clear, a strong opponent can have more than double your farm in less than 8 minutes, because of her other weaknesses, don't make the little farm that she can get so hard to hit too :(
Thank you for this thoughtful response. I agree, a little flexibility in her build path would be most welcome.

Anivia is 100% fine. As an avid Anivia player, I can tell you she definitely doesn't deserve the difficulty rating of 10. She's easy as shit. Early game throw that Q through the minion wave, if it hits an enemy champ, slap them with the E for a strong targetted poke, if not, oh well continue farming and try again. Once you hit 6, eat minion waves with ult and slap enemy champ with E every time they get near your minions. If they engage, Q stun or wall, another slap with E, and they should be dead. 

Seriously the hardest part about anivia is dealing with idiots that don't know how to play WITH her. Can't tell you how many times I've started fights with three or more enemy champions by myself, knowing full well that I can stall them out for a very long time while my nearby teammates collapse on them and kill them only to have my teammates NOT show up because "Anivia got caught out". No, Anivia did not get caught out. Anivia was baiting with her vast amount of stalls so you guys could come in and ace them. 

The reason she has low base movement speed is because she's a kiting champion. Movement speed buffs would be more of a buff to her than it would be to other champions that don't rely on kiting as much. The reason she has low base health is because she has a rebirth passive that can potentially give her all of her health back. 

She is fine where she's at. The only thing I would fix is the fact that her Q still turns invisible randomly for both her and her enemies. And I'd give her a better AA animation as hers is probably the worst in the game. She doesn't need MS, she doesn't need health, she needs a better AA animation. That's it.

Toggles activate to trigger a continuous passive ability. Aatrox, Amumu, Cho, Mundo, Elise, Jayce, Jinx, Karthus, Singed, Swain, and Warwick have toggles. 

Anivia's ult counts as activating an ability for sheen, toggles do not. Anivia ult is disrupted by CC and the use of Zhonyas, toggles are not. Most importantly, Anivia's ult has a RANGE that cancels the ability if you walk outside of it, toggles do not. In all aspects but name, Anivia's ult is a channel, not a toggle.
